channel.title: Running Injury Free
channel.description: Learn the basics of running injury and pain free, and enjoy it! http://www.leigh.org/running/

item.title: A Low-Stress Marathon Plan
item.description: A low-stress training plan for marathons and half-marathons. Train for and run your marathon or half-marathon without the pain that many runners experience! http://www.leigh.org/running/
item.itunes:summary: A low-stress training plan for marathons and half-marathons. Train for and run your marathon or half-marathon without the pain that many runners experience! http://www.leigh.org/running/

item.title: Pain: Friend or Foe?
item.description: Make pain your friend. Pain is a signal from your body that your body has a problem and needs more rest. http://www.leigh.org/running/
item.itunes:summary: Make pain your friend. Pain is a signal from your body that your body has a problem and needs more rest. http://www.leigh.org/running/

item.title: Stress: Running Destroys Your Body
item.description: The stress from running destroys body cells. During periods of rest, your body responds and becomes stronger. http://www.leigh.org/running/
item.itunes:summary: The stress from running destroys body cells. During periods of rest, your body responds and becomes stronger. http://www.leigh.org/running/

item.title: The 10% Rule
item.description: When you increase your distance or pace, do it in small increments. http://www.leigh.org/running/
item.itunes:summary: When you increase your distance or pace, do it in small increments. http://www.leigh.org/running/

item.title: Run Heavy/Light
item.description: Avoid injury and enjoy your runs by running heavy/light. http://www.leigh.org/running/
item.itunes:summary: Avoid injury and enjoy your runs by running heavy/light. http://www.leigh.org/running/

item.title: Warm up -- Cool down
item.description: Before you begin your run, take a few minutes to warm up your body and get it ready for the stress of running. When finished with your run, take a few minutes to cool down before you hit the shower. http://www.leigh.org/running/
item.itunes:summary: Before you begin your run, take a few minutes to warm up your body and get it ready for the stress of running. When finished with your run, take a few minutes to cool down before you hit the shower. http://www.leigh.org/running/

item.title: Another Comment on Stretching
item.description: Stretching after you run helps remove lactic acid from your muscles. Lactic acid is one of the causes of stiffness after people have a hard workout, especially if they're not in very good shape. It is produced from anaerobic glucose metabolism. http://www.leigh.org/running/
item.itunes:summary: Stretching after you run helps remove lactic acid from your muscles. Lactic acid is one of the causes of stiffness after people have a hard workout, especially if they're not in very good shape. It is produced from anaerobic glucose metabolism. http://www.leigh.org/running/

item.title: Stretch Your Muscles
item.description: Avoid injury by stretching your muscles. Stretches loosen your muscles and strengthen them. http://www.leigh.org/running/
item.itunes:summary: Avoid injury by stretching your muscles. Stretches loosen your muscles and strengthen them. http://www.leigh.org/running/

item.title: Your Running Pace
item.description: Runners use pace not speed to measure their performance. Your Personal Best (PB) is your fastest pace for a given distance. http://www.leigh.org/running/
item.itunes:summary: Runners use pace not speed to measure their performance. Your Personal Best (PB) is your fastest pace for a given distance. http://www.leigh.org/running/

item.title: Long Slow Distance
item.description: Running long slow distance at a comfortable pace should be the mainstay of your running program. http://www.leigh.org/running/
item.itunes:summary: Running long slow distance at a comfortable pace should be the mainstay of your running program. http://www.leigh.org/running/

item.title: Getting Started
item.description: Getting started running injury free and enjoying it. http://www.leigh.org/running/
item.itunes:summary: Getting started running injury free and enjoying it. http://www.leigh.org/running/
